titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Alfred (Abby) Loeb Wolf was a lawyer and pilot. He was a partner in the law firm of Wolf, Block, Schorr, and Solis-Cohen, specializing in both aviation law and patent, trademark, and copyright law. He was a member of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, and sponsored and participated in a number of the Academy's collecting expeditions, including those to the Great Barrier Reef in 1969 and to the Cocos (Keeling) Islands in 1974.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of Wolf's voyages and his involvement in expeditions of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. Destinations of the expeditions and voyages include Ceylon, Australia, and Fiji (1971-1972), the Maldives (1974), Cocos (Keeling) Islands (1974), the Virgin Islands (1979), the Bahamas (1981), and Bermuda (1983). Materials include: incoming and outgoing correspondence; bills and receipts; brochures and travel guides; maps and charts; photographs and slides; newspaper clippings, articles, and reprints; sales brochures for diving and photography equipment; and packing lists for the trips. Among the topics covered in the correspondence are trip planning, books and articles on explorations and sea voyages, and Wolf's financial and practical support of several Academy expeditions. The collection also includes personal items, such as a copy of Wolf's will, a copy of remarks made at his memorial service in 1985, and books from his collection, several of which relate to Cook's Pacific voyage.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Connie Wolf (Mrs. Alfred L. Wolf)
